thread.title: M Kodandaram's Facebook appeal receives 1,23,000 views
thread.title_full: M Kodandaram's Facebook appeal receives 1,23,000 views

title: M Kodandaram's Facebook appeal receives 1,23,000 views
text: M Kodandaram's Facebook appeal receives 1,23,000 views M Kodandaram's Facebook appeal receives 1,23,000 views Following up on his call to use social media platforms for spreading the word about the TJAC programmes, the TJAC chairman Prof M Kodandaram reached out to people on Facebook to join the February 22 rally for the unemployed in the city. TNN | Feb 8, 2017, 09.47 AM IST Representative image HYDERABAD: Following up on his call to use social media platforms for spreading the word about the TJAC programmes , the TJAC chairman Prof M Kodandaram reached out to people on Facebook to join the February 22 rally for the unemployed in the city . Kodandaram's call racked up a total of 123,000 views since his live appeal on the social media platform with more than 2,300 persons sharing a recorded version of the TJAC chairman's call. The TJAC said in the 24 hours since Prof. Kodandaram's spoke live on Facebook, a total of 3,52,000 persons viewed the brief speech on various social media platforms. Prof. Kodandaram in his outreach made it clear that while the TJAC is not holding the government responsible for the plight of the unemployed, the government had to do its part to keep its promise of filling more than a lakh vacancies it said it would fill.
